isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3000FE, 3000RE - 3000RE CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Remove fuse F11 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove horn relay (R6) and re-install fuse F11. At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 85, then repair.
At relay connector (R6), measure voltage from cavity E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 85B, then repair.
Bench test horn relay by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 86 and a ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
At relay connector (R6), measure voltage from cavity B to cavity A while horn button is depressed.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in horn control circuit between relay connector and horn button ground, then repair.
At relay connector, install jumper between cavity B and cavity C. Does horn sound?
Disconnect horn connector. Measure voltage from circuit 85C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 85C or conn. (2), then repair.
At connector, measure voltage across circuit 85C to the 85-G grounding bolt.
Locate open or poor connection in the horn mounting brackets or circuit 85-G/ 11-GB, then repair.
At connector pigtail, measure voltage from circuit 85D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 85D, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and install relay. Reconnect horn connectors.
Check rear control box fuse B3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse B3, measure voltage from circuit 13P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13P, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect air dryer connector (75). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 39 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39, conn. (74), circuit 39B/39, conn. (3) or circuit 39, then repair.
At (75) measure voltage across circuit 39 to 39-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 39-GA, conn. (74), circuit 39-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
At (75) install jumper from circuit 39B to heater element feed. With key on and unit cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from element ground terminal to ground.
Repair or replace heated air dryer.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connector (75). Air dryer circuitry checks good.
Check rear control box fuse A4 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Check rear control box fuse B2 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse A4 and circuit 13L, measure voltage to ground.
Re- install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13L, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Disconnect ECM connector (379). Install a jumper wire from circuit 92F to ground. Remove modulator solenoid relay (403) and at cavity 5, circuit 97F, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97F or control box conn. (3), then repair.
At relay socket cavity 1, circuit 92B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92B/92D, then repair.
At fuse socket cavity 2, circuit 92B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92B, then repair.
Bench test modulator solenoid relay (403) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (403) by applying +12V to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (403) and disconnect modulator shift solenoid connector (32). Measure voltage from circuit 92C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92C or control box conn. (3), then repair.
At connector (32), measure voltage from circuit 92C to 92-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 92-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect connector (32). Does modulator shift solenoid actuate?
Disconnect neutral position switch connector (N/L) and measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P or control box conn. (3), then repair.
Place transmission in neutral and measure resistance of switch.
Reconnect neutral position switch and remove crank relay (385). At relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 97L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97L or control box conn. (3), then repair.
Transmission wiring checks good. Remove test jumper and reconnect connector (379) and (385).
Check rear control box fuse A3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse A3, measure voltage from circuit 13L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13L, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect air dryer/ drain valve connector (42). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 39A (red) to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39A or drain valve to chassis harness conn. (43), chassis to electronic engine harness conn. (197), or control box conn. (3), then repair.
At (42) measure voltage across circuit 39A (red) to 39-GA (brown).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 39-G, conn. (43), or circuit 39-G/ 11-GA/ 11-GB, then repair.
At (42) install jumper from circuit 39A to heater element feed. With key on and unit cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from element ground terminal to ground.
Remove jumper and reconnect pigtail connector. Drain valve circuitry checks good.

svcsubproc.title: Heated Fuel Filter With Water-In-Fuel Light, Fuel Filter Restriction Light

table.title: Heated Fuel Filter With Water-In-Fuel Light, Fuel Filter Restriction Light

entry.para: Does the fuel filter restriction light work properly?
Does the water-in-fuel system operate properly?
Does the heated fuel filter work properly?
Remove fuel heater relay (R5). At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity E, circuit 19H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19H, or open fuse F17, then repair.
At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity B, circuit 19D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19D, or open fuse F20, then repair.
At relay socket (R5), measure voltage from cavity B to cavity A, circuit 11-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GA, then repair.
Bench test fuel filter relay (R5) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (R5) and disconnect circuit 19A from fuel filter. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 19A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19A, dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
With the fuel heater cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from circuit 19A to the heater power stud.
Fuel filter, 19A to heater power stud.
Heated fuel filter system checks good.
Repair or replace heated fuel filter.
Disconnect water-in-fuel module (16). Turn key on and at connector, measure voltage from circuit 19E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19E, then repair.
At WIF socket (16), measure voltage across circuit 19E to 19-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19-GB, or key switch, then repair.
At WIF socket (16), install jumper from circuit 19E to 19F. Does warning light operate?
Disconnect WIF warning light conn. (9) and at circuit 19F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19F, then repair.
At WIF connector (9), measure voltage across circuit 19F to 19-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19-G/ 11-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
At WIF connector (16) move jumper across circuit 19E to 19C. At the fuel filter, disconnect circuit 19C from the water probe. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 19C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19C, dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect WIF module (16). At water probe connector, jumper circuit 19C to ground. Does light work?
Remove water probe and install jumper from the probe to ground. Measure voltage from circuit 19C to water probe feed stud.
Water probe, 19C to probe feed stud.
Install probe and connections. WIF system checks good.
Remove fuel filter light connector (69) and measure voltage from circuit 19J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19J or open fuse F25, then repair.
Reconnect light connector (69) and disconnect fuel filter switch connector (N/L). Measure voltage from circuit 19B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19B, dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
Fuel filter restriction light circuitry checks good. If condition persists, replace fuel filter switch.
Remove pump control relay (R1) and measure voltage from circuit 90 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in fusible link 90-FL/ 90FA, circuit 90, or conn. (2), then repair.
At relay socket (R1), install jumper wire from cavity E, circuit 90 to cavity C, circuit 90S. Does pump motor run?
At pump motor, disconnect connector and measure voltage from circuit 90S to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90S or conn. (2) or (88), then repair.
At pump motor connector, measure voltage from circuit 90S to pump casing.
Pump motor conn., 90S to pump case.
Locate open or poor connection in ground circuit from pump case to platform ground, then repair.
Bench test relay (R1) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove fuse F2 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F2, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit 90A to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90A or dash conn. (2), then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove fuse F12 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F12, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit 14A to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove fuse F18 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F18, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit 13A to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13A, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove stop light relay (R4). At socket cavity B circuit 70D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70D or 70B, then repair.
Bench test relay (R4) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove brake relay (R3). Measure resistance of circuit 70-G between cavity A of relay (R3) and cavity D of relay (R4).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70-G, then repair.
Re-install relay (R4). At relay (R3) socket, measure voltage from cavity E, circuit 90X to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90U or 90X, then repair.
Bench test relay (R3) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (R3). Disconnect connector from brake/stop light switch (209). At connector, measure voltage from circuit 90B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90B, or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At connector (209), measure resistance from circuit 90-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/ 11-GB, then repair.
At connector (209), measure voltage from circuit 70C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At switch (209) and with brake pedal applied, measure resistance from blue wire terminal to black wire terminal.
Reconnect (209) and disconnect flow switch connector (N/L). Measure resistance from switch terminal to ground.
Reconnect flow switch connector and disconnect differential pressure switch connector (91). Measure resistance from circuit 90L to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90L, then repair.
At switch (91), measure resistance from each terminal to ground.
Reconnect switch (91) and disconnect connector (88). At (88) measure resistance from circuit 90K to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90K, then repair.
Disconnect monitor module connector (86). At connector (86-A), measure resistance from circuit 90L to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90L/90K, then repair.
At relay socket (R1), measure resistance from cavity A, circuit 90E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90E, then repair.
Remove blocking diode from connector (80). With pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit 90F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90F, then repair.
At (80) measure voltage from circuit 90T to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90T, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode (80). Does diode test good?
Re-install diode (80). With brake pedal depressed and at monitor module connector (86), measure voltage from (86-H) circuit 90C, and (86-G) circuit 90D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90C and/or 90D, then repair.
At (86-E), measure voltage from circuit 90H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90H, then repair.
At (86-D), measure resistance from circuit 11-GD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GD/ 11-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
At pump control relay socket (R1), measure voltage from circuit 90J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90J, then repair.
Re-install pump control relay (R1). Turn key on and at connector (86-F), measure voltage from circuit 90Q to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90Q, dash conn. (2) or conn. (88), then repair.
Disconnect alarm blocking diode (25). At connector, measure voltage from alarm circuit 90NA to ground. Alarm should activate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90NA, fuse F24 and alarm feed circuit 13B, or check alarm operation, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode (25). Does diode test good?
At connector (25), measure voltage from warning light circuit 90N/90M to ground. Warning light should activate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 90N, cluster conn. (12), printed circuit board, or feed circuit 28A, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 90M between connectors (25) and (86-C).
Locate open in circuit 90M, then repair.
Re-install monitor module (86). Disconnect body builder connector (169). With brakes applied, measure voltage from circuit 70A to ground.
Reconnect conn. (169). Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70A, then repair.
Hydraulic brake pump motor and stop light circuitry checks good. With brakes applied, does pump motor run?
With engine not running and brakes released, does pump motor run and warning system activate?
With engine running, does alarm system deactivate?
